Key Match Events: San Diego's Jurickson Profar reached into the left-field seats to rob Mookie Betts of a home run.
Jack Flaherty drilled Fernando Tatis Jr. in the left leg with an 0-1 fastball.
Profar's bunt single put two men on base.
Flaherty struck out Manny Machado for the first out in the sixth inning.
The game was delayed for roughly 10 minutes as order was restored after fans threw objects at Padres players.
The Padres responded with four home runs over the final two innings, including Tatis' second of the night in the top of the ninth.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers starting pitcher Jack Flaherty emphasized that fans should never get involved by throwing objects at players.
Fernando Tatis Jr. expressed that being hit by a pitch gave him more energy and confidence in his team.
Jack Flaherty denied intentionally hitting Tatis and explained his pitching strategy.
Manny Machado criticized Flaherty for hitting Tatis and emphasized the importance of getting players out rather than hitting them.
Jurickson Profar expressed his frustration with fans throwing objects and emphasized player safety.
Padres manager Mike Shildt praised his team's resilience and ability to elevate their game in a hostile environment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Security and umpire crew chief Dan Bellino took measures to ensure player safety after fans threw objects onto the field.
The public address announcer warned fans against throwing objects onto the field.
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts noted that he had never seen such behavior from fans in over 1,000 games at Dodger Stadium.
